com.palantir.giraffe.host

Class Host

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.palantir.giraffe.host.Host

  • public final class Host
extends Object
    Represents a host with a unique hostname in a network.

    Localhost Handling

    This class attempts to resolve all representations of the local host to the same object. The canonical local host object is the one returned by localhost(). Factory methods that perform resolution return this object when given any loopback IP address or the string "localhost".

    • Method Detail

      • addLocalUriScheme

        public static void addLocalUriScheme(String scheme)
        Adds a URI scheme to the set used by fromUri(URI) to identify the localhost URIs.

        By default, the file scheme is included.

        Parameters:
        scheme - the scheme to add

      • fromHostname

        public static Host fromHostname(String name)
        Creates a Host from a valid hostname. The hostname is resolved to an InetAddress, which is used to create the host.
        Parameters:
        name - the hostname to resolve
        Throws:
        InetAddressUnresolvableException - if the hostname cannot be resolved

      • fromUri

        public static Host fromUri(URI uri)
        Gets a Host from a URI.

        If the URI's scheme identifies resources on this host or if the host component is "localhost", returns the local host object. Otherwise, use the host component of the URI.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI from which to extract the host
        Returns:
        a host for the given URI
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the URI has no host component and does not have a known scheme

      • localhost

        public static Host localhost()
        Gets the Host representing the local host.
        Throws:
        InetAddressUnresolvableException - if "localhost" cannot be resolved

      • fromInetAddress

        public static Host fromInetAddress(InetAddress ia)
        Creates a Host from an InetAddress using the saved or resolved hostname.
        Parameters:
        ia - the InetAddress

      • fromHostnameUnresolved

        public static Host fromHostnameUnresolved(String name)
        Creates a Host with the given literal hostname. This method does not perform localhost resolution and getHostname() always returns the given hostname.
        Parameters:
        name - the hostname

      • getHostname

        public String getHostname()
        Returns the hostname of this host. The hostname is set at construction time and may not be in canonical form.
        See Also:
        getCanonicalHostname()

      • getInetAddress

        public InetAddress getInetAddress()
        Resolves this host's hostname to an IP address.
        Returns:
        an InetAddress for this host
        Throws:
        InetAddressUnresolvableException - if the hostname cannot be resolved

      • getCanonicalHostname

        public String getCanonicalHostname()
        Gets this host's canonical hostname by performing a reverse DNS lookup on this host's IP address.
        See Also:
        InetAddress.getCanonicalHostName()

      • resolvesToHost

        public boolean resolvesToHost(Host other)
        Determines if this host has the same canonical name as another host.
        Parameters:
        other - the other host
        Returns:
        true if the hosts have the same canonical hostname
        Throws:
        InetAddressUnresolvableException - if either hostname cannot be resolved

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Determines if this Host is equal to another Host. Two Hosts are equal if they have the same hostname.
